description: A Maasai warrior in traditional attire is depicted using a telephone booth located in a savanna setting, an absurd juxtaposition of modern technology and a traditional environment. He is seemingly calling a woman named Mrs. Harriet Schwartz to inquire if she is missing a specific little boy, who stands beside the phone booth carrying a bindle on a stick. The scene presents a surreal situation where a member of a tribal community appears to have located a lost urban child and is formally contacting the potential parent via public telephone in the wilderness, highlighting the unexpected intersection of disparate worlds.
caption: "Mrs. Harriet Schwartz? This is Zathu Nananga of the Maasai. ... Are you missing a little boy, Mrs. Schwartz?"
